name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Dean Court Hotel

reviews.text: A wondeful stay. Not the cheapest hotel in York, but it certainly is one of the best I have ever stayed in. Couldn't fault my stay at all - would definitley return. If you don't like it then I don't know what you would like.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My other half and I stayed here over the weekend of the 26th-27th January. We were really impressed with the hotel itself - simple unpretentious extrerior and interior but the communal areas really smart and clean. We ate in the restaurant both nights and the food was almost unformally great. On both nights the restaurant was busy with guests and locals.
reviews.title: Great hotel in York

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival we found that our bedding contained feathers which both my partner and I are allergic too. Once we had made this clear to reception it was changed quickly and without fuss.
reviews.title: Perfect place for a weekend getaway

likes.liked: — the view of the Minster and the proximity to the city
likes.disliked: — the walls were a bit thin if you get a noisy neighbour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a terrific location - the York Minster overlooks the hotel. Everything within easy walking distance so a perfect hotel for a weekend break or indeed longer.
reviews.title: Great location and rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent the weekend here as a birthday treat and were impressed from start to finish. There were signs in reception and in the rooms warning of impending refurbishments on the third floor but we saw and heard nothing. The room was a standard double with a view accross to the Minster and was a nice size - certainly not small as some others have stated, though incredibly hot even on a cold night in january. It was spotlessly clean and the bathroom was spacious with a fabulous shower and complimentary toiletries. The breakfast was a bit slow to arrive and some of it was overcooked and quite greasy but not too bad a start to the day. The staff were all very friendly and approachable.
reviews.title: Brilliant Location

likes.liked: — The room size and molton brown toiletries

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staying one night in York for a brief break caused a dilemna for my partner and I, but only in terms of where to stay. Well, wonder no longer. We wouldn't go further than the Dene Court Hotel for any future visit. Literally, right next to the Minster and in such a central position that restaurants and shops were close to hand. The room (No 20) was nicely furnished with the biggest bed (one of those 'Super Kingsize' jobbies) I'd slept in. Honestly, it was like sleeping on my own, there was so much space! The en-suite was large, with a wall separating the wet room at one end (shower [including a seat and handrail for the disabled], toilet and washbasin) and the bath at the other end. The decor was nice but not terrific, going for the contemporary look but somehow not quite pulling it off. A moot point though. This hotel is great. I particularly loved the staff. They were so helpful. The valet parking (I object to paying for parking, but £8 we thought was cheap for the city) was a great service. They allowed us to remain parked with them the following day for no extra charge. Nothing was too much trouble for us. I felt truly welcome.
reviews.title: An Easter Treat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We dined at Ask (the Assembly Rooms). Nice meal but too big and little atmosphere. Next time we'd dine at the hotel because the ambience looked so good and we were impressed by the AA rosette awards. My recommendation is not to go for the cheaper small bedrooms - I took a peak in and I'd have been disappointed. You couldn't swing a cat. Our standard room was lovely and very spacious.
reviews.title: Great if you dont smell of smoke.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great place,great location ,great bar,but terrible management.My wife and I are smokers who smoked outside of the hotel then put them out on the sidewalk(no ashtray or trash can available) we then place the butts in the trash can in our room.On our return home four days later we recieve a letter from the manager saying we smoked in the room in which we did not and that we would be charged 150 pounds ($309) My wife who had used amex for that nights stay responded to the manager via e-mail the very next day and told him that we had not smoked in the room and recieved a reply that said "it was abundantly clear to us that the room was very smokey on enetering" this is a complete lie unless one of there own people had smoked in it. Like I said this is a great place but if you smoke do not stay here I would also suggest you have the manager check the room before you leave to make sure everything is in order to avoid any outlandish charges. The hotel even held our bags for about two hours after we had checked out and said nothing of this on our return.If they knew of this why say nothing ?
reviews.title: Top hotel in the most perfect location in historic York

reviews.text: We managed to secure a room for one night on Valentines night to celebrate our anniversary.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay
among the best service decor,food and location in the entire world
reviews.text: The hotel is opposite the minster and we had a room that looked out onto the magnificent building. The room was a decent size and was tastefully decorated.

reviews.title: Perfect location
reviews.text: Hotel is right in front of Minster, so location is excellent. Other than location, room was small and not worth the price. View of Minster was nice though, and you are in the heart of the city here. About an 8 block walk from train station, and a lovely walk it is.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not much to hotel other than location. Small reception and bar area.
reviews.title: BEST IN YORK

reviews.text: Booked on line - excellent hotel ....staff were great .......the location a big plus....over looking the minster.. 5 minutes walk from the tour bus pick up point.
reviews.title: Its the location. . .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a large double room, very clean, great room, bathroom shower, large flat screen TV. Only negative room very stuffy and hot,
reviews.title: Unbeatable

reviews.text: Excellent food ..... but expensive.
reviews.title: Poor Breakfast service and Family rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a brilliant hotel from start to finish. It's so easy from start to finish. Let me start by saying that the hotel is very easy to locate and is in the best location in the entire of York.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: Me and my wife pulled up directly outside the main entrance and went to check in. This went smoothly and our car keys handed over to a member of staff who took our car to a secure car park (£8.00 per day - quite reasonable for York).
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were just as we expected. Not huge but just what we needed. Very clean and tidy and the bed extremely comfortable. We did however feel as though the room got a little stuffy despite having the window open and the portable air con machine switched on.
reviews.title: Comfort in a superb location

reviews.text: Back to the location; unbeatable. Sitting right in the shadow of the minster and only a short walk away from everything. A few minutes to the Shambles, 10 mins to Jorvik, 10 mins to York Dungeon, 15 mins to National Railway Museum/York Eye and hundreds of pubs and restaurants on your door step.
reviews.title: Outstandingly good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only got chance to eat breakfast in the hotel as we thought with so many little gems around us it would be a shame to miss out on them (try the Blue Bicycle). The breakfast was good, the usual range and everything you would expect.
reviews.title: Fantastic Weekend.

description: The Dean Court has the finest location in the city, standing in the shadow of York Minster. Everything is within walking distance, including city walls and all York’s famous attractions.The hotel recently received a Trip Advisor Certificate of Excellence and is a previous winner of the regional Hotel of the Year Award.Entering one finds contemporary design, with emphasis on elegance and comfort. Rooms are well-equipped and individually styled. Superior and de Luxe rooms have outstanding views of the Minster. Rooms have flat screen TVs, 30 ftv channels and DVD players. There’s an extensive range of DVD's and an iPOD docking station. Little “extras” include robes, brollies and mineral water. There is free Wi-Fi throughout the hotel. The Dean Court is notably child-friendly with four well equipped family rooms. Guests with limited mobility or in wheelchairs will also enjoy facilities in a quartet of rooms. Ramp access is available with staff assistance, all public rooms and restaurants are on one level, no steps. D.C.H the Restaurant has AA Rosette Awards whilst THE COURT Café Bistro & Bar offers a more informal menu in a setting with mixed seating styles. Throughout the year there are events including Afternoon Cream Tea WITH STRINGS ATTACHED. Both eateries offer the finest food and service, with local and seasonal local produce predominant in menus .There is an impressive range for vegetarian guests and those with gluten free diets. The eighty-bin wine list offers twenty wines by the glass, and a large choice of beers from local breweries and around the world. An extensive cocktail list is available too.The hotel is non-smoking. Public areas are air-conditioned. The hotel has its own secure car park, and offers a free valet-parking service
